Title: Police arrest three suspects for burning idol worshipper’s house in Ilorin
Summary: Police arrest three suspects for burning idol worshipper's house in Ilorin . Kwara State Police Command has arrested three suspected arsonists for burning the property of a traditional worshipper .

Title: Education is never a gamble — VP Shettima
Summary: Ooni of Ife installed Chancellor at Kashim Ibrahim University Vice President Kashim Shettima declared that no investment in education is ever a gamble . He described the sector as a deliberate and enduring commitment to securing Nigeria’s future .

Title: Foundation launches ‘Adopt a Senior Citizen’ initiative in Port Harcourt
Summary: The O.B. Lulu-Briggs Foundation has launched a new humanitarian initiative, Adopt a Senior Citizen, aimed at strengthening long-term care and support for elderly persons in Port Harcourt and neighbouring communities . The initiative is part of the foundation’s Care for the Elderly .

Title: Your guide to starting 2026 well
Summary: After the rush of December, the first weekend of the year arrives quietly . It’s a chance to pause, breathe, reset, and ease gently into the months ahead . This is not the season for pressure or grand declarations . Instead, it's about about how to start 2026 well .

Title: You are truly a reformer, Ooni of Ife tells Borno gov
Summary: The Ooni of Ife, His Imperial Majesty, Oba Adeyeye Enitan Ogunwusi Ojaja II, has described Borno State Governor Babagana Zulum as a true reformer . The monarch made the commendation on Friday .

Title: Venezuela’s ‘hour of freedom’ has arrived – Opposition leader Machado
Summary: Opposition leader Machado is abroad in an unknown location after travelling under cover to Oslo in December to receive her Nobel, which she dedicated to US President Donald Trump .

Title: PDP suspends Rivers caretaker committee chairman for hobnobbing with Wike
Summary: The party said it suspended Ewor both as caretaker chairman and as a member for his actions that are capable of destroying the PDP in the state .

Title: Trump posts photo of handcuffed, blindfolded Maduro
Summary: President Donald Trump posted a photo Saturday of Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro in custody on a US naval ship . Maduro was wearing both a blindfold and handcuffs .

Title: Top African countries by domestic airline capacity this festive season
Summary: Nigeria is the second-largest domestic market on the continent but saw a 7.5% contraction in available seats in December 2025 . Nigeria is second largest domestic market in Africa .

Title: We deployed 1,800 officers to manage Christmas, New Year traffic — LASTMA boss
Summary: Lagos State Traffic Management Authority said it deployed no fewer than 1,800 officers across key locations in the state to manage traffic during the Christmas and New Year festivities .

Title: Maduro, wife to face trial for narco-terrorism, cocaine trafficking — US Attorney General
Summary: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, will face trial in the United States on charges including narco-terrorism and cocaine trafficking, US Attorney General Pam Bondi confirmed on Saturday . The charges include “Narco-Terrorism Conspiracy,” conspiracy to import cocaine, and offenses related to machineguns . The

Title: Soludo's wife urges Nigerians to embrace positivity in 2026
Summary: Anambra State First Lady, Dr. Nonye Soludo, has urged Nigerians to develop a positive mind in the year 2026 . Soludo stated this in a statement released on Saturday to commemorate the 2026 ‘International Mind-Body Wellness Day’ celebrated globally every January 3 . She said sound mind and

Title: Rivers Ijaw Congress announces support for Wike
Summary: The announcement was made on Saturday in Okrika Local Government Area during a “thank you” visit by Wike to the community . The development comes amid renewed political tension in Rivers State, stemming from the prolonged dispute between Wike, a former governor of the state, and Fubara . Title: Shehu Sani, Sowore condemn US capture of Venezuela’s Maduro
Summary: Former Nigerian senator Shehu Sani and human rights activist Omoyele Sowore criticised the Venezuelan operation . President Donald Trump claimed that U.S. forces had carried out a “large-scale strike” in Venezuela . UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres expressed that he was “deeply alarmed” by

Title: Ekiti schools to resume Monday – Commissioner
Summary: Ekiti State Commissioner for Education, Dr Olabimpe Aderiye, announced schools would resume on Monday, January 5 . The schools had been on holiday since December following the completion of the first term of the 2025/2026 academic session for the Christmas and New Year festivities .
